## Iris Data

1. One Species
2. Three Genus
3. One or three distributions for each numeric variable?

The observations by each species:

```{r data,echo=FALSE,message=FALSE,warning=FALSE}
data("iris")
table(iris$Species)
```

How many distributions?

---

## How many distributions?

```{r,echo=FALSE,message=FALSE,warning=FALSE,results='asis'}
library(ggplot2)
library(gridExtra)
i1 <- ggplot(data=iris,aes(x=iris$Sepal.Length,y=..count..,label=..count..),
             stat="count", position="dodge")+ geom_histogram()
i2 <- ggplot(data=iris,aes(x=iris$Sepal.Width,y=..count..,label=..count..),
             stat="count", position="dodge")+ geom_histogram()
i3 <- ggplot(data=iris,aes(x=iris$Petal.Length,y=..count..,label=..count..),
             stat="count", position="dodge")+ geom_histogram()
i4 <- ggplot(data=iris,aes(x=iris$Petal.Width,y=..count..,label=..count..),
             stat="count", position="dodge")+ geom_histogram()
grid.arrange(i1,i2,i3,i4, ncol = 2, nrow = 2)

```

```{r opts.label='shiny',echo=FALSE,results='asis',message=FALSE,warning=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
library(devtools)
library(slidify)
library(slidifyLibraries)
library(shiny)
library(shinyapps)
slidifyUI(fluidPage(
        titlePanel("Iris Data: Some Exploratory Plots"),
        # Sidebar Layout
        sidebarLayout(
                sidebarPanel(
                        # First choice: histogram or scatter plot
                        selectInput(
                                inputId = "plotType",
                                label = "Plot Type",
                                c(Scatter ="Scatter Plot",
                                  Histogram = "Histogram")),
                        # Second choice:
                        # 2nd choice is a scatter plot
                        conditionalPanel(condition="input.plotType == 'Scatter Plot'",
                                         selectInput(
                                                 inputId = "x_var",
                                                 label = "X Variable",
                                                 names(iris),
                                                 selected = names(iris)[[1]]
                                         ),
                                         selectInput(
                                                 inputId = "y_var",
                                                 label = "Y Variable",
                                                 names(iris),
                                                 selected = names(iris)[[3]]
                                         )
                        ),

                        # 2nd choice was histogram
                        conditionalPanel(condition="input.plotType == 'Histogram'",
                                         sliderInput(inputId = "bins",
                                                     label = "Number of bins:",
                                                     min = 5, max = 60, value = 35),
                                         selectInput(
                                                 inputId = "x_hist",
                                                 label = "Variable",
                                                 names(iris),
                                                 selected = names(iris)[[1]]
                                         )
                        )
                ),
                # Show the selected plot
                mainPanel(
                        plotOutput(outputId = "main_plot")
                        #tags$div(id = 'main_plot', class= 'shiny-plot-outpu')
                )
        )
)
)
```

Some error at integration between Shiny and Slidify; the same alone shiny app works well.
